text: but listen you don't get the depth perception that you do in real life. A pilots ability to think on the fly is unmatched as well as their ability to think outside of normal parameters and do things a computer wouldn't because it would be programed to follow the rules. Plus here is a big concept. You can't hack a human. Another thing have you seen Stealth, that sort of thing can happen. Also if you are in the cockpit you don't get that seconds delay because a signal has to relayed of a satellite

author: Sean Saunders

text:
This is really really cinematic. In fact, if you hadn't told me it was from a video game, I would have thought it to be from a war movie of some sort. It's the dramatic orchestration, and the drawn out arrangement that separate it from most VGM.

No complaints though, just noting that it treads the shrinking frontier between video game music and film score.
